organization.description:
The Ontology Engineering Group (OEG) is based at the Computer Science School at Universidad Polit√©cnica de Madrid (UPM). Our main research areas are: Ontological Engineering, (Social) Semantic Web and Linked Data, Natural Language, Semantic e-Science and the Future Internet. The group has developed applications in a wide range of domains, including knowledge management, software Application Lifecycle Management, e-commerce, job and funding search, geo-localisation, R&D project management, etc.

Special mention deserves Linked Data applications in partnership with the National Geographic Institute of Spain (GeolinkedData), the Spanish National Library (datos.bne.es), Prisa Digital (El Viajero) and Fundeu (Terminesp). In addition, OEG maintains the Spanish chapter of DBpedia, and has participated and is currently participating in many standardization activities at the W3C such as the Linked Data Platform specification, PROV-O provenance ontology, Sensor Network Ontology, Ontolex model for ontology-lexica, Best practices for Multilingual Linked Open Data. We have also participated in ISO/TC 37 Committee activities within the SC 4 and in the ISO/TC 37/TCG /Terminology Coordination Group.
organization.title: Ontology Engineering Group (UPM)
organization.name: oeg-upm

name: wings-workflow-provenance-dataset
notes:
Dataset containing traces of the execution of Wings workflows. Both the traces and the specifications of the workflows are exported and are derreferenceable. The models used are OPM and PROV-O (using a vocabulary extension called OPMW, http://www.opmw.org/model/OPMW/).
Additional metadata of each workflow and each template is exported as well (creator, sucess in the execution, end time, etc).

extras.value: This dataset is a product of a joint collaboration between the ISI (University of Southern California) and the OEG (Universidad Politecnica of Madrid)

title: Wings workflow provenance dataset
